title: Allow numbers in custom objects system names

body:
## Checklist before requesting a review

- [x] I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my code.
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

## Description

People may want to use numbers in custom assets system names. Prior to GLPI 9.4, it was possible to use classnames with numbers in the search engine, for instance via the genericobject plugin. This possibility disappeared when the search engine was refactored, and we did not reverted this limitation because the issue was detected only after the GLPI 9.4.0 release (see https://github.com/glpi-project/glpi/pull/5495).

I think we could reintroduce the possibility to use numbers in itemtypes. The search engine has many test and some of them will probably fail if an unexpected side effect is introduced by this change.
@orthagh @trasher Would you agree to reintroduce the ability to use numbers in itemtype classnames (e.g. `Glpi\CustomDropdown\Alpha3CountryCode`) ?
